ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: This course is extremely self-guided, so I learned from the labs I was already involved with.
I learned how to develop original research into a manuscript style piece of writing.
I got more experience working in a lab.
I learned how to find the literature necessary to inform my research question and how to test said research question with sound empirical data collection.

Being able to get credit and support for doing senior thesis research during the semester is very valuable. You learn to work independently and you are able to gain skills that pertain to your research area of interest.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: There is no infrastructure for this course, so it is entirely student-driven.
Very unstructured - which worked well for me! I liked having the freedom and flexibility to work on my own timeline.
could be improved through more guidance from the department
Very little guidance on how to approach the senior thesis prior to being a senior
I'm glad there was an information session about the different EEB research classes and requirements, but I wish it was done sooner.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: This course is required for E&EB seniors.
gotta do what ya gotta do
I would recommend senior research to anyone with an interest in real-world studies, and this course facilitated that.
Yes, but organization and communication are key to a successful research experience.
